bibl.title: Letter from Albert Woldert to Henry Rose Carter, February 16, 1923

div1.p: Woldert requests that Carter send him information on anti-malarial work.

div1.head: Letter from Albert Woldert to Henry Rose Carter, February 16, 1923
div1.opener:
B={mal. p of the South
{Crossett - B -
V. H. get. from St. Sps
S. W.-
Send - N. O. Paper
M. M. C.
Reprints
DR. ALBERT WOLDERT
ROOMS 3,4 AND 5 HERNDON BLDG.
TYLER, TEXAS
February 16th-23.
Doctor H.R. Carter,
Wasington, D.C.
Dear Doctor:
div1.p:
I am preparing a paper entitled “The Eradication
of Malarial Fever from Texas”, and to be read before the meeting
of Texas State Medical Association at Fort Worth, in May.

I would be glad if you would send me any literature bearing on
this question, especially the cost of malarial fever; and also the good
results obtained anywhere in America from antimalarial work.
Please also send me about 3 or 4 copies (if you can spare them)
of your pamphlet Supplement No. 18 entitled Malaria Lessons on
Its Causes and Prevention.

I will also appreciate it if you would give me about 10 to 20
suggestions as to how you would go about eradicating malarial
fever in Texas, numbering your suggestions serially as
I--
2--
3--
4--etc.

I presume you have read my former contributions on this subject
printed in Transactions of State Medical Association of Texas for
1904, page 37p also in American Journal Medical Sciences for
March 1903, and in Journal American Medical Association for March
2nd-1921.
Thanking you in advance for above courtesies, I remain,
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Albert Woldert. See Other Side
I recall that I once had the pleasure of meeting you at one
of the meetings of our State Medical Association--probably at
Austin in 1904, when I read my paper.
W.
